# Prepare random file randfile="$(mktemp -t 'downvid')" echo -n "$(pbpaste)" >> "${randfile}"
# Check if WatchList is being used, and show options accordingly watchlist="$(dirname "${alfred_workflow_data}")/com.vitorgalvao.alfred.watchlist/towatch"
if [[ -f "${watchlist}" ]]; then cat << EOF <?xml version='1.0'?><items> <item uid='Regular Download' arg='${randfile} watchlist_false' valid='yes'> <title>DownVid</title> <subtitle>Downloads the video to your Desktop</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid='Download To WatchList' arg='${randfile} watchlist_true' valid='yes'> <title>DownVid + WatchList</title> <subtitle>Downloads the video to ~/Downloads and adds it to your watchlist</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> EOF else cat << EOF <?xml version='1.0'?><items> <item uid='Regular Download' arg='${randfile}' valid='yes'> <title>DownVid</title> <subtitle>Downloads the video to your Desktop</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> EOF fi
Download videos from popular sources (uses the URL in your clipboard)

queue_state="${state}" readonly progressfile='/tmp/downvidprogress'
if [[ -f "${progressfile}" ]]; then filename=$(cat "${progressfile}" | grep '\[download\] Destination: ' | sed 's/\[download\] Destination: //') progress=$(cat "${progressfile}" | tail -1 | sed 's/^\[download\] *//')
echo " <?xml version='1.0'?><output>
<rerun>1</rerun>
<items> <item valid='no'> <title>${alfred_workflow_name} Progress</title> <subtitle>${progress} | <![CDATA[$(basename "${filename}")]]></subtitle> <mod key='ctrl' valid='yes' /> <mod key='cmd' valid='yes' /> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> </output> " else if [[ -z "${queue_state}" ]]; then echo " <?xml version='1.0'?><output>
<rerun>3</rerun> <variables> <variable name='state'>stopped</variable> </variables>
<items> <item valid='no'> <title>${alfred_workflow_name} Progress</title> <subtitle>Checking for downloads in queue…</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> </output> " else # ${state} == 'stopped' echo " <?xml version='1.0'?><output>
<rerun>3</rerun>
<items> <item valid='no'> <title>${alfred_workflow_name} Progress</title> <subtitle>All downloads finished!</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items> </output> " fi fi
Shows progress of the current DownVid download
Installs OS X Services to allow you to download from urls without having to manually call Alfred

Download videos from [a plethora of video sources](https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/supportedsites.html), even when embedded to other pages.
Copy a link to your clipboard, run `dv`, and you’re done. The workflow will show you a notification when it starts downloading and another when finished.
If you have [WatchList](https://github.com/vitorgalvao/alfred-workflows/tree/master/WatchList) you’ll see an option to automatically add the downloaded video to your watchlist.
![](https://i.imgur.com/44IZmNI.png)
Run with the ⌘ modifier, and the full playlist the video is part of will be downloaded.
To see the download progress, run `dvp`. It will auto-refresh the progress. Actioning it with the ⌘ modifier will restart the current download (adding it to the back of the queue), while actioning with ⌃ will abort the current download.
![](https://i.imgur.com/Za25OhO.png)
You can also add DownVid actions to macOS Services, by running `:installdownvidservices` (if you ever want to remove them, simply delete them from the `~/Library/Services` directory). What this means is wherever you find a URL, you’ll be able to right click it and start the download right from the context menu.
![](https://i.imgur.com/7yheG3N.png)
The two Workflow Environment Variables represent the directories (relative to your home) where videos will download to.
